content.rendered:
NATURAL FIBRES FOR SUSTAINABLE PRODUCT APPLICATIONS

THE POWER OF NATURAL FIBRES


The fibcro® natural fibres, developed by BIO-LUTIONS, offer versatile characteristics, adaptable for a wide range of product solutions. Working closely with our customers, we analyse their performance needs and create products with suitable characteristics.

The mechanical conversion of agricultural residues allows the fibres to retain their natural composition. This means that we do not isolate the cellulose of the natural material but instead can use the natural fibre as a whole. This patented process allows for an extremely low raw material volume loss during the conversion process. 

THE POWER OF NATURAL FIBRES


The fibcro® natural fibres, developed by BIO-LUTIONS, offer versatile characteristics, adaptable for a wide range of product solutions. Working closely with our customers, we analyse their performance needs and create products with suitable characteristics.

The mechanical conversion of agricultural residues allows the fibres to retain their natural composition. This means that we do not isolate the cellulose of the natural material but instead can use the natural fibre as a whole. This patented process allows for an extremely low raw material volume loss during the conversion process. 

DISPOSABLE PRODUCTS OF TODAY AND TOMORROW


Our products focus on the most prominent consumer pressure points; single-use items such as trays, cuttlery or cup lids. We want to enable businesses to be environmentally responsible in safely transporting their goods while offering consumers the ability to radically reduce plastic in their lives. Our products are biodegradable, compostable, food-safe, robust and odour neutral.

DISPOSABLE PRODUCTS OF TODAY AND TOMORROW


Our products focus on the most prominent consumer pressure points; single-use items such as trays, cuttlery or cup lids. We want to enable businesses to be environmentally responsible in safely transporting their goods while offering consumers the ability to radically reduce plastic in their lives. Our products are biodegradable, compostable, food-safe, robust and odour neutral.

SUITABLE PROCESSING TECHNOLOGIES


Our range of biodegradable fibcro® natural fibre-based products is currently manufactured using either wet-moulding or dry-moulding technology. The so called dry-moulding process functions completely without water. We are the first to implement this production process, which we have successfully adapted to our innovative agricultural fibres. However, these two methods are by far not the only suitable processing technologies. That is why we are focusing our research efforts on adapting other technologies to our needs, such as injection moulding and extrusion. Each processing technology unlocks new and exciting product possibilities.

Find out more about our production sites here.


WET-MOULDING




INJECTION-MOULDING

SUITABLE PROCESSING TECHNOLOGIES


Our range of biodegradable fibcro® natural fibre-based products is currently manufactured using either wet-moulding or dry-moulding technology. The so called dry-moulding process functions completely without water. We are the first to implement this production process, which we have successfully adapted to our innovative agricultural fibres. However, these two methods are by far not the only suitable processing technologies. That is why we are focusing our research efforts on adapting other technologies to our needs, such as injection moulding and extrusion. Each processing technology unlocks new and exciting product possibilities.

Find out more about our production sites here.


WET-MOULDING


DRY-MOULDING


EXTRUSION


INJECTION-MOULDING


EXTRACTION


SCANNING

RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT PARTNERS

LIMITLESS POSSIBILITIES FOR PRODUCT INNOVATION


The unique characteristics of our fibcro® natural fibres make it an attractive material for high-performance products such as sporting goods as well as car panels, furniture and many more industries. As a natural composite for insulation, stability or sound reduction, our material can help make many industries and products more sustainable. Together with leading experts in fibre technology and material innovation, our team in Schwedt/Oder, Germany is exploring new areas of use for our revolutionary fibres.
